text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comma with dirty dirty rice that's right
i love dirty rice but i've always
dreamed of doing an extra dirty version
and what follows is my fairly successful
attempt to do just that and one little
word of warning before we proceed while
the final results are absolutely
delicious and relatively attractive
parts of the actual procedure to make
this are absolutely horrifying
as in you should probably make this
alone with no one watching you so with
that ominous warning out of the way
let's go ahead and get started and first
up we're gonna fry a little bit of
freshly diced pork in a little bit of
vegetable oil over medium-high heat and
all this is is a piece of pork shoulder
that i cubed up and what we'll do is fry
this until it starts to get crisp and
most of the fat renders out and if
you're wondering if you could use bacon
instead of course you can or if you want
you could use a cure done smoked pork
like a pancetta which would also be
greatness okay so use what you want
I mean you are after all the Andrew Dice
Clay of your dirty dirty rice play but I
went with the easy to find relatively
inexpensive pork shoulder and like I
said we're gonna cook that until it's
nicely browned and we've rendered out a
good amount of fat in which we're gonna
cook the next set of ingredients the
Holy Trinity and if you're familiar with
the cook in a Louisiana you know that
that means a trio of onions celery and
green peppers and along with that we
will also toss in a nice big pinch of
salt and we'll go ahead and saute those
until they start to soften and sweeten
and turn translucent and it really is
this amazing amalgamation of pork fat
and aromatic vegetables deforms the
foundation of this recipe and so many
other recipes from New Orleans for that
matter but anyway like I said we'll go
ahead and cook those stirring until they
start to soften up and turn translucent
and then once that happens we can go
ahead and toss in our spices herbs and
seasonings which will include a whole
bunch of paprika
all right regulars fine smokes fine
spices fine or any combination and then
we will also add in a little bit of
cumin as well as some freshly ground
black pepper also known as my second
favorite kind of pepper followed by my
favorite kind a little touch of cayenne
and then we didn't use any fresh garlic
here because we're gonna add in some
garlic powder
which gives you a little different
flavor and both would work and then
we'll finish up with a little bit of
dried oregano and a little bit of dried
thyme and we will continue cooking this
for about five minutes or so stirring
occasionally so as to wake up all those
spices as well as continuing to soften
and sweeten those veggies and while
we're waiting for that to happen we can
move on to it is definitely the most
horrifying part of this production and
that would be 2 finely chopped up some
raw chicken livers and not a little a
lot all right this is like 8 ounces and
it's one of the main reasons this dirty
dirty rice is so filthy and all we need
to do here is just chop this with a
large knife until we basically have a
puree a disgusting horrifying visually
disturbing puree and then what we'll do
once that's been completed is maybe look
out the window at a flower or something
to cleanse our eyes and then we'll set
that aside and go back and check our
veggies which by now are looking
beautifully soft and sweet and at this
point we will lower our heat to medium
and assuming your veggies are looking
just as amazing what we'll do is go
ahead and add some diced andouille
sausage and cook that for about 2 or 3
minutes and then do use just a smoked
pork sausage so if you can't find that
anything similar will work and the
reason I didn't add this at the
beginning is that I find the flavors
from the sausage can overwhelm the other
ingredients if it's fried at the
beginning and all that fat renders out
so I prefer to add it at this point and
just cook it for a couple minutes and
then once that's been accomplished we
can go ahead and add in our liver puree
which again is just an absolute horror
show
but the profound deliciousness of the
final product makes all the nightmares
worth it and then once that's in we will
also add our long grain rice and then
slowly and thoughtfully stir all this
together
and we will keep stirring until our
beautiful liver puree is mixed in and we
are very confident all those grains of
rice are coated in all this fatty
goodness I mean besides that we're also
gonna want to add some salt which looks
like too much because I'm using large
grain kosher salt but it's not and for
the record we could added that at any
time but anyway we'll toss that in at
which point we can add in hopefully a
nice rich homemade chicken broth but if
not just a decent store-bought version
will work and we will go ahead and stir
that in and then we're also going to
want to turn our heat up
to medium-high because before we cover
this we do want it simmering and then
what we'll do while we wait for that to
start to bubble is that the last couple
ingredients which are bay leaf as well
as a little splash of Worcestershire
sauce and we'll give that a quick stir
and then as soon as this comes to a
simmer what we'll do is cover it tightly
reduce our heat to medium-low and cook
it without stirring for about 25 minutes
at which point it should look a little
something like this
alright most but not all of the liquid
will be absorbed and our grains of rice
will be starting to get tender but they
won't be cooked yet and it's at this
stage we will stir in some green onions
and parsley first of all because they're
gonna taste good but secondly because we
want to give this rice a stir okay
please be aware that when you cook rice
in something that's not water
alright like a tomato sauce for example
or something like this it tends to cook
a lot slower and more unevenly
so what we're gonna do is give this a
very good mix and then we'll kind of
even it back out at which point we will
recover it and continue cooking down low
to medium low until our rice is
perfectly tender and a little bit sticky
which depending on your pan and heat
level it's gonna take maybe 10 15 who
knows could be 20 minutes but you'll
know because you'll taste it and test it
and of course while we're checking for
texture we might as well taste for
seasoning since we always do that before
we serve anything and then assuming
you're happy with it which you will be
we'll go ahead and transfer that into
some kind of serving dish and maybe
garnish the top with some green onions
and that's it our dirty dirty rice is
done and I could not wait to grab a fork
and dig in oh by the way when I
mentioned the rice should be tender in a
little bit sticky there's two kinds of
stickiness with rice there's rice that
gets sticky because it's overcooked and
it gets mushy and pasty that's not the
kind of sticky we want okay what we want
is grains of rice that are perfectly
tender but have a little film of starch
on the outside so the grains are still
separate and hold their shape but they
will stick together a little bit that's
what we're going for and above and
beyond texture the level of savoriness
and meatiness here is just off the
charts right this is so rich and
satisfying it could be a meal on to
itself and the main difference between
this and regular dirty rice is it
traditionally dirty rice is made by
cooking the right
first and then just mixing all the dirty
ingredients in at the end before you
serve it
whereas here with dirty dirty rice we
actually added all that dirty filthy
mess in at the beginning so that all
those amazing flavors would be absorbed
into the grain as it cooked and it
really does make a tremendous difference
and yes I could have just kept you in
that as is but decide to try it under
another experiment swamp chicken which
didn't really come out as I thought so
I'm not sure if I'm gonna show it but
the beautiful thing about this rice is
that it really doesn't matter what you
serve with it since it really does steal
the show oh and I should mention if you
don't tell people there's liver in it
they might not notice right that's how
meaty and delicious this is and then
maybe you tell them later maybe you
don't that's up to you but whether you
trick your friends into eating organ
meat or not I really do hope you give
this a try soon so head over to food
wishes calm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always
you
